article_text: Support from black voters is Hillary Clinton’s “firewall and most certain path to the nomination,” writes Juan Williams. Fortunately for Mrs. Clinton, Bernie Sanders “is unknown in much of nonwhite America.” But Joe Biden would present a different kind of challenge. A recent Washington Post/ABC poll found that 67% of blacks view him favorably. And “if the president were to get into a dispute” with Mrs. Clinton, “abandon his neutrality, or even throw his support to Mr. Biden, if he decides to run, Mrs. Clinton’s glide path to...

twitter.description: Blacks don’t know who Bernie Sanders is, plus Iran’s mullahs thank the U.S. for their nuclear deal and free enterprise is “under assault.”
twitter.title: Hillary’s ‘Firewall’

article_summary:
Support from black voters is Hillary Clinton’s “firewall and most certain path to the nomination,” writes Juan Williams.
Fortunately for Mrs. Clinton, Bernie Sanders “is unknown in much of nonwhite America.” But Joe Biden would present a different kind of challenge.
And “if the president were to get into a dispute” with Mrs. Clinton, “abandon his neutrality, or even throw his support to Mr. Biden, if he decides to run, Mrs. Clinton’s glide path to...
A recent Washington Post/ABC poll found that 67% of blacks view him favorably.
